FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: study

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric code for this study

FIELD.LABEL: First Name
FIELD.NAME: contact_first_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Given first name

FIELD.LABEL: Last Name
FIELD.NAME: contact_last_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Given last name

FIELD.LABEL: Email
FIELD.NAME: contact_email
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Valid email address

FIELD.LABEL: Institution
FIELD.NAME: institutionCode
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The code or abbreviation representing the lead institution responsible for the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Title
FIELD.NAME: title
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An official title for the study or project. Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Study of Spatial Transcriptomics related to Fish

FIELD.LABEL: Description
FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A detailed description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach. Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication
FIELD.EXAMPLE: This project explores the intricate details of spatial transcriptomics in fish.

FIELD.LABEL: Bibliographic Citation
FIELD.NAME: bibliographicCitation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A citation for the study resource, following a standard format.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Doe J., et al. (2024). Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis of Fish. Journal of Biology.

FIELD.LABEL: Created
FIELD.NAME: created
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date when the study was created or registered.

FIELD.LABEL: Workflow
FIELD.NAME: workflow
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The workflow or protocol followed during the study.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample

FIELD.LABEL: Sample ID
FIELD.NAME: sample_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Study Reference
FIELD.NAME: study_reference
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A reference to the study, usually a unique identifier or citation.

FIELD.LABEL: Strain
FIELD.NAME: strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The strain of the organism, if applicable.

FIELD.LABEL: Tissue
FIELD.NAME: tissue
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of tissue sampled for the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Preservation Method
FIELD.NAME: preservation_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of how the sample was preserved.

FIELD.LABEL: Age Class
FIELD.NAME: AgeClass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The age class of the organism at the time of collection.

FIELD.LABEL: Event Date
FIELD.NAME: eventDate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date when the sample was collected.

FIELD.LABEL: Geographic Location Latitude
FIELD.NAME: geographic_location_latitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographic latitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90. We advise that locations are specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and a maximum of 8 decimal places (https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees).

FIELD.LABEL: Geographic Location Longitude
FIELD.NAME: geographic_location_longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographic longitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180. We advise that locations are specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and maximum of 8 decimal places (https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees).

FIELD.LABEL: Broad Scale Environmental Context
FIELD.NAME: broad_scale_environmental_context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvOâ€™s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: Local Scale Environmental Context
FIELD.NAME: local_scale_environmental_context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: Environmental Medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental_medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: Country
FIELD.NAME: country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The country where the sample was collected.

FIELD.LABEL: Day
FIELD.NAME: day
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The integer day of the month on which the sample was collected.

FIELD.LABEL: Decimal Latitude
FIELD.NAME: decimalLatitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographic latitude of the sample collection site, in decimal degrees.

FIELD.LABEL: Decimal Longitude
FIELD.NAME: decimalLongitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The longitude of the sample collection site, in decimal degrees.

FIELD.LABEL: Family
FIELD.NAME: family
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The taxonomic family of the organism.

FIELD.LABEL: Genus
FIELD.NAME: genus
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The taxonomic genus of the organism.

FIELD.LABEL: Habitat
FIELD.NAME: habitat
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of habitat where the sample was collected.

FIELD.LABEL: Life Stage
FIELD.NAME: lifeStage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The life stage or age class of the organism when sampled.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ^(Adult|Egg|Embryo|Gametophyte|Juvenile|Larva|Pupa|Spore bearing structure|Sporophyte|Vegetative cell|Vegetative structure|Zygote|Not applicable|Not collected|Not provided)$

FIELD.LABEL: Material Entity ID
FIELD.NAME: materialEntityID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique unique alphanumeric identifier for the material entity (sample).

FIELD.LABEL: Material Sample ID
FIELD.NAME: materialSampleID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for the sample.

FIELD.LABEL: Month
FIELD.NAME: month
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The month when the sample was collected.

FIELD.LABEL: Order
FIELD.NAME: order
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The taxonomic order of the organism.

FIELD.LABEL: Organism Name
FIELD.NAME: organismName
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the organism.

FIELD.LABEL: Record Number
FIELD.NAME: recordNumber
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique number assigned to this record.

FIELD.LABEL: Scientific Name
FIELD.NAME: scientificName
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The scientific name of the organism.

FIELD.LABEL: Sex
FIELD.NAME: sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The sex of the organism (if applicable).

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ^(Asexual morph|Female|Hermaphrodite monoecious|Male|Sexual morph|Not applicable|Not collected|Not provided)$

FIELD.LABEL: Taxon ID
FIELD.NAME: taxonID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier for species or organism studied.

FIELD.LABEL: Taxon Rank
FIELD.NAME: taxonRank
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The rank of the taxon for this organism.

FIELD.LABEL: Year
FIELD.NAME: year
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The four-digit year in which the sample was collected.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: imaging_protocol

FIELD.LABEL: Imaging Protocol ID
FIELD.NAME: imaging_protocol_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier for the sample used in the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Platform
FIELD.NAME: platform
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The platform used to isolate the cells.

FIELD.LABEL: Instrument
FIELD.NAME: instrument
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The instrument used to isolate the cells.

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Method
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method used for dissociating the cells.

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Time
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_time
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time duration for dissociation in minutes.

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Temperature
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature at which dissociation is performed in degrees celsius.

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Enzyme
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_enzyme
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The enzyme used for dissociation.

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Enzyme Concentration
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_enzyme_concentration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The concentration of the dissociation enzyme.

FIELD.LABEL: Material Incubation Temperature
FIELD.NAME: material_incubation_temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature at which the material is incubated in degrees C.

FIELD.LABEL: Material Incubation Time
FIELD.NAME: material_incubation_time
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time duration for material incubation in hours.

FIELD.LABEL: Lysis Buffer Solution
FIELD.NAME: lysis_buffer_solution
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The solution used for lysis buffer.

FIELD.LABEL: Target Probes
FIELD.NAME: target_probes
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of probes used to detect and quantify specific RNA molecules in their native spatial context within a tissue or cell.

FIELD.LABEL: Section Thickness Îœm
FIELD.NAME: section_thickness_Âµm
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The thickness of the tissue section in micrometres.

FIELD.LABEL: Section Thickness Method
FIELD.NAME: section_thickness_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method used to measure tissue section thickness.

FIELD.LABEL: Section Thickness Temperature
FIELD.NAME: section_thickness_temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature at which the section was made.

FIELD.LABEL: Is Pathological
FIELD.NAME: is_pathological
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being abnormal and having a destructive effect on living tissue.

FIELD.LABEL: Digestion Workflow
FIELD.NAME: digestion_workflow
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a workflow describing the digestion protocol in Protocols.io

FIELD.LABEL: Digestion Time In Minutes
FIELD.NAME: digestion_time_in_minutes
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The duration of digestion in minutes.

FIELD.LABEL: Digestion Temperature
FIELD.NAME: digestion_temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature at which digestion was carried out.

FIELD.LABEL: Photobleaching Duration in Hours
FIELD.NAME: photobleaching_duration_in_hours
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The duration of photobleaching in hours

FIELD.LABEL: Instrument User Guide
FIELD.NAME: instrument_user_guide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The user guide for the instrument used.

FIELD.LABEL: Instrument User Guide Revision
FIELD.NAME: instrument_user_guide_revision
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The revision of the instrument user guide.

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Preparation Guide
FIELD.NAME: sample_preparation_guide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The guide used for sample preparation.

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Preparation Guide Revision
FIELD.NAME: sample_preparation_guide_revision
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The revision of the sample preparation guide.

FIELD.LABEL: Deviations from Official Protocol
FIELD.NAME: deviations_from_official_protocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any deviations from the official protocol. Separate individual deviations with '|'

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: file

FIELD.LABEL: Imaging Protocol Reference
FIELD.NAME: imaging_protocol_ref
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains the imaging protocol information.

FIELD.LABEL: File Name
FIELD.NAME: file_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A filename or file name is a name used to uniquely identify a data file related to the study.

FIELD.LABEL: File Type
FIELD.NAME: file_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A file type is a name given to a specific kind of file. Commong file types are fastq, gtf, fasta, bam, etc.
